query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Quando il settentrïon del primo cielo, 2 che né occaso mai seppe né orto 3 né d’altra nebbia che di colpa velo,
query.error: **English:** 1 When the septentrion of the first heaven, 2 which never knew setting nor rising, 3 nor any veil of mist except of sin,
query.result: 1 Pan veu an seythennor a'n kynsa nef, 2 na wodhya kov an goslow na'n est, 3 na neb owr avel orth y gila colp,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 e che faceva lì ciascun accorto 5 di suo dover, come ’l più basso face 6 qual temon gira per venire a porto,
query.error: **English:** 4 and which made everyone there aware 5 of his duty, just as the lowest one does 6 like a rudder that turns to reach port,
query.result: 4 ha'ga re beu oll ena ena 5 a'y dhevys, dell yw an moyha 6 dell temon ow treylya dhe'n fordh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 fermo s’affisse: la gente verace, 8 venuta prima tra ’l grifone ed esso, 9 al carro volse sé come a sua pace;
query.error: **English:** 7 stood still: the truthful people, 8 who had come first between the griffin and it, 9 turned to the chariot as to their peace;
query.result: 7 a veu sevel: an dus dus gwir, 8 ow tos kyns an grifon ha henna, 9 dhe'n karros a drehevis dell y hedh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 e un di loro, quasi da ciel messo, 11 ‘Veni, sponsa, de Libano’ cantando 12 gridò tre volte, e tutti li altri appresso.
query.error: **English:** 10 and one of them, as if sent from heaven, 11 sang “Veni, sponsa, de Libano” three times, 12 and all the others followed him.
query.result: 10 ha unn a-dhya, avel orth ow tos a'n nef, 11 ow kanna “Veni, sponsa, de Libano” 12 teyr gweyth, ha'n dus dus erel wosa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Quali i beati al novissimo bando 14 surgeran presti ognun di sua caverna, 15 la revestita voce alleluiando,
query.error: **English:** 13 As the blessed at the final summons 14 will rise up quickly, each one from his tomb, 15 their voices clothed in hallelujahs,
query.result: 13 Dell an dus dus benygys dhe'n galow diwettha 14 a sevysi byskyn pub unn a'y ogof, 15 aga lef avel orth ow kanna alleluia,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 cotali in su la divina basterna 17 si levar cento, ad vocem tanti senis, 18 ministri e messaggier di vita etterna.
query.error: **English:** 16 so on the divine litter 17 a hundred rose up, at the voice of so old a man, 18 ministers and messengers of eternal life.
query.result: 16 cottal warbarth an basterna dhiwin 17 a sevis cans, dhe'n lef an hen dhen, 18 mynistri ha messager a vewnans bys vyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Tutti dicean: ‘Benedictus qui venis!’, 20 e fior gittando e di sopra e dintorno, 21 ‘Manibus, oh, date lilïa plenis!’.
query.error: **English:** 19 All said: “Benedictus qui venis!”, 20 and throwing flowers above and around, 21 “Manibus, oh, date lilia plenis!”.
query.result: 19 Pub on leveris: “Benedictus qui venis!”, 20 ha aga floryow ow talleth warbarth ha’n-dro, 21 “Manibus, oh, date lilia plenis!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Io vidi già nel cominciar del giorno 23 la parte orïental tutta rosata, 24 e l’altro ciel di bel sereno addorno;
query.error: **English:** 22 I once saw at the beginning of the day 23 the eastern sky all rosy, 24 and the other sky adorned with beautiful clear weather;
query.result: 22 Me a welas kyns yn komensa an jydh 23 an rann est oll rosliw, 24 ha'n nef erel avel orth ow addorna gans serenn,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 e la faccia del sol nascere ombrata, 26 sì che per temperanza di vapori 27 l’occhio la sostenea lunga fïata:
query.error: **English:** 25 and the face of the sun rising veiled, 26 so that because of the moderation of the vapors 27 the eye could bear it for a long time:
query.result: 25 ha fas an howl ow tos ow ombrosa, 26 dell drehevys avel orth an vaporyow 27 an lagha a alla y dhe bys vyth:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 così dentro una nuvola di fiori 29 che da le mani angeliche saliva 30 e ricadeva in giù dentro e di fori,
query.error: **English:** 28 thus within a cloud of flowers 29 that rose from angelic hands 30 and fell back down inside and out,
query.result: 28 cottal a-berth onnenn a floryow 29 ow tos a'n dhew angelik 30 ha ow kodha warbarth a-berth ha a-ves,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 sovra candido vel cinta d’uliva 32 donna m’apparve, sotto verde manto 33 vestita di color di fiamma viva.
query.error: **English:** 31 over a white veil, wreathed with olive, 32 a lady appeared to me, beneath a green mantle, 33 dressed in the color of living flame.
query.result: 31 warbarth vel gwyn, ow kolya gans oliv, 32 on benen a veu dhe'm, a-woles gans mantell gwer, 33 ow vista gans liv an flamm byw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E lo spirito mio, che già cotanto 35 tempo era stato ch’a la sua presenza 36 non era di stupor, tremando, affranto,
query.error: **English:** 34 And my spirit, which for so long a time 35 had been in her presence 36 that it was not overcome with amazement, trembling,
query.result: 34 Ha'm sperys, ow po dhe bys vyth cotter 35 termyn o syns pan veu dhe'y presens 36 na veu ow affranta gans stupor, ow temya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 sanza de li occhi aver più conoscenza, 38 per occulta virtù che da lei mosse, 39 d’antico amor sentì la gran potenza.
query.error: **English:** 37 without having any more awareness of my eyes, 38 through a hidden power that moved from her, 39 felt the great power of ancient love.
query.result: 37 hebma bos an lagha moyha, 38 drehevys cusul ow tos a-dhya, 39 a welas an gallos a'n karanteer koth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Tosto che ne la vista mi percosse 41 l’alta virtù che già m’avea trafitto 42 prima ch’io fuor di püerizia fosse,
query.error: **English:** 40 As soon as the great power struck my sight, 41 which had already pierced me 42 before I was out of childhood,
query.result: 40 Bytte gyn tas dhe'm yn an golwg 41 an gallos ughel owth a'm po treghys 42 kyns o po dhe'm a-ves a bys vyth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 volsimi a la sinistra col respitto 44 col quale il fantolin corre a la mamma 45 quando ha paura o quando elli è afflitto,
query.error: **English:** 43 I turned to the left with the respect 44 with which a small child runs to its mother 45 when it is afraid or when it is distressed,
query.result: 43 y'm drehevis dhe'n klew gans an respys 44 dell y fantolin ow resek dhe'y vamm 45 pan vo poow ha pan vo afflythys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 per dicere a Virgilio: ‘Men che dramma 47 di sangue m’è rimaso che non tremi: 48 conosco i segni de l’antica fiamma’.
query.error: **English:** 46 to say to Virgil: “Less than a dram 47 of blood is left in me that does not tremble: 48 I recognize the signs of the ancient flame.”
query.result: 46 rag leverel dhe Virgili: “Men ages dram 47 a wos gavas dhe'm na wra tremble: 48 y'm gorra an sinow a'n flamm koth.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Ma Virgilio n’avea lasciati scemi 50 di sé, Virgilio dolcissimo patre, 51 Virgilio a cui per mia salute die’mi;
query.error: **English:** 49 But Virgil had not left us bereft 50 of himself, Virgil, sweetest father, 51 Virgil to whom I had entrusted myself for my salvation;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 né quantunque perdeo l’antica matre, 53 valse a le guance nette di rugiada, 54 che, lagrimando, non tornasser atre.
query.error: **English:** 52 nor however much he had lost his ancient mother, 53 it was enough for his cheeks, clean of dew, 54 that, weeping, they did not turn dark again.
query.result: 52 na pyth pan gollas y vamm koth, 53 na veu dhe'y wosow gwyn a ros, 54 na wra torna du pan veu ow lagrya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 «Dante, perché Virgilio se ne vada, 56 non pianger anco, non piangere ancora; 57 ché pianger ti conven per altra spada».
query.error: **English:** 55 “Dante, do not weep yet, do not weep yet 56 because Virgil is leaving, 57 for you must weep for another sword.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Quasi ammiraglio che in poppa e in prora 59 viene a veder la gente che ministra 60 per li altri legni, e a ben far l’incora;
query.error: **English:** 58 Like an admiral who comes to see 59 from the poop and the prow the people who serve 60 on the other ships, and to set the course well;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 in su la sponda del carro sinistra, 62 quando mi volsi al suon del nome mio, 63 che di necessità qui si registra,
query.error: **English:** 61 on the left bank of the chariot, 62 when I turned at the sound of my name, 63 which must be recorded here,
query.result: 61 warbarth an rann klew a'n karros, 62 pan y'm drehevis dhe'n lef an'm hanow, 63 ow po dhe'm ow rekorda ena,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 vidi la donna che pria m’appario 65 velata sotto l’angelica festa, 66 drizzar li occhi ver’ me di qua dal rio.
query.error: **English:** 64 I saw the lady who had first appeared to me, 65 veiled beneath the angelic festival, 66 turn her eyes towards me from across the stream.
query.result: 64 y'm welas an benen owth a'm po ow tos 65 avel orth ow ombrosa a-woles an festa angelik, 66 ow drehevel y lagha dhe'm a-dhyworth an avon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Tutto che ’l vel che le scendea di testa, 68 cerchiato de le fronde di Minerva, 69 non la lasciasse parer manifesta,
query.error: **English:** 67 All that the veil that descended from her head, 68 encircled by the leaves of Minerva, 69 did not let her appear clearly,
query.result: 67 Oll an gwisk a wra dheworth y'n fen, 68 keworrys gans delyow Minerva, 69 nyns lettyas hwra kler,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 regalmente ne l’atto ancor proterva 71 continüò come colui che dice 72 e ’l più caldo parlar dietro reserva:
query.error: **English:** 70 regally in her demeanor still haughty 71 she continued like one who speaks 72 and reserves the warmest words for last:
query.result: 70 yn royal yn y semlant bythkott, 71 hi a leveris kepar unn den a wra leveris 72 ow kewsel an gerow tomma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 «Guardaci ben! Ben son, ben son Beatrice. 74 Come degnasti d’accedere al monte? 75 non sapei tu che qui è l’uom felice?».
query.error: **English:** 73 “Look at me well! I am indeed, I am indeed Beatrice. 74 How did you dare to ascend the mountain? 75 Don’t you know that here is where man is happy?”.
query.result: 73 “Sel gwel yn dha! My a wra, my a wra Beatrice. 74 Pynag eus dewis dhe vos dhe’n menydh? 75 Ny wodhvos dha bosma an den lowen yma?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Li occhi mi cadder giù nel chiaro fonte; 77 ma veggendomi in esso, i trassi a l’erba, 78 tanta vergogna mi gravò la fronte.
query.error: **English:** 76 My eyes fell down into the clear spring; 77 but seeing myself in it, I turned them to the grass, 78 so much shame weighed down my brow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Così la madre al figlio par superba, 80 com’ ella parve a me; perché d’amaro 81 sente il sapor de la pietade acerba.
query.error: **English:** 79 Thus a mother appears proud to her son, 80 as she appeared to me; because the taste of bitter 81 pity is harsh.
query.result: 79 Vel henna an mamm dhe'y mab a wra leveris owen, 80 kepar ha henna a wra leveris dhe'm; rag an blas 81 a'n keusder a wra kaletter an keusder grev.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Ella si tacque; e li angeli cantaro 83 di sùbito ‘In te, Domine, speravi’; 84 ma oltre ‘pedes meos’ non passaro.
query.error: **English:** 82 She fell silent; and the angels suddenly sang 83 ‘In te, Domine, speravi’; 84 but they did not go beyond ‘pedes meos’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Sì come neve tra le vive travi 86 per lo dosso d’Italia si congela, 87 soffiata e stretta da li venti schiavi,
query.error: **English:** 85 Just as snow among the living rafters 86 freezes on the ridge of Italy, 87 blown and compacted by the slavish winds,
query.result: 85 Kepar erow ynter an gweliow byw, 86 war-barth Itali a wra kevys, 87 sethys ha gwaskys gans an gwynsow sklav,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 poi, liquefatta, in sé stessa trapela, 89 pur che la terra che perde ombra spiri, 90 sì che par foco fonder la candela;
query.error: **English:** 88 then, melted, seeps into itself, 89 as soon as the earth that loses its shadow breathes, 90 so that it seems like fire melting a candle;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 così fui sanza lagrime e sospiri 92 anzi ’l cantar di quei che notan sempre 93 dietro a le note de li etterni giri;
query.error: **English:** 91 thus I was without tears and sighs 92 before the song of those who always sing 93 following the notes of the eternal spheres;
query.result: 91 vel henna yth o vy heb degerow ha heb syghys, 92 kyns an gana a’n re beu notya byth 93 wosa notyow an troholyow byth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 ma poi che ’ntesi ne le dolci tempre 95 lor compatire a me, par che se detto 96 avesser: ‘Donna, perché sì lo stempre?’,
query.error: **English:** 94 but after I heard in their sweet melodies 95 their pity for me, it seemed as if they said: 96 ‘Lady, why do you grieve so?’,
query.result: 94 Mes wosa’m klevos ena y’n gerensa dowr, 95 aga keusder dhe’m, ytho henna ow leveris: 96 ‘Benyn, peraga’th owth ow teudhi vel henna?’,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 lo gel che m’era intorno al cor ristretto, 98 spirito e acqua fessi, e con angoscia 99 de la bocca e de li occhi uscì del petto.
query.error: **English:** 97 the ice that was constricted around my heart 98 turned into spirit and water, and with anguish 99 it exited my chest through my mouth and eyes.
query.result: 97 an erow a wra ow keworra y’m galon, 98 a wra spyrys ha dowr, ha gans angos 99 a’n kever ha’n lagha a wra dallethys dhyworth y’m brust.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Ella, pur ferma in su la detta coscia 101 del carro stando, a le sustanze pie 102 volse le sue parole così poscia:
query.error: **English:** 100 She, standing still on the said side 101 of the chariot, then turned her words 102 to the pious substances thus:
query.result: 100 Hi, ow sevel yn fast war-barth an kos gena, 101 a wra ow sevel war-barth an kar, dhe’n substansow pious 102 a droas y’n gerow vel henna:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 «Voi vigilate ne l’etterno die, 104 sì che notte né sonno a voi non fura 105 passo che faccia il secol per sue vie;
query.error: **English:** 103 “You keep watch in the eternal day, 104 so that neither night nor sleep steals from you 105 any step that the world takes on its paths;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 onde la mia risposta è con più cura 107 che m’intenda colui che di là piagne, 108 perché sia colpa e duol d’una misura.
query.error: **English:** 106 therefore my answer is with greater care 107 so that he who weeps over there may understand me, 108 so that his fault and grief may be of equal measure.
query.result: 106 rag henna y’m gorra a wra gans moy a vraster 107 dhe henna a wra ow weli y’m, an den a wra ow gul y’nno, 108 rag henna y’n feth ha’n dowr a wra ow mosur par.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Non pur per ovra de le rote magne, 110 che drizzan ciascun seme ad alcun fine 111 secondo che le stelle son compagne,
query.error: **English:** 109 Not only because of the operation of the great wheels, 110 which direct every seed to a certain end 111 according to the stars that accompany them,
query.result: 109 Nyns esom rag ober an rodo mawr, 110 a wra ow drysi pub egin dhe unn fin, 111 herwydh an steren a wra ow kestow,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 ma per larghezza di grazie divine, 113 che sì alti vapori hanno a lor piova, 114 che nostre viste là non van vicine,
query.error: **English:** 112 but because of the abundance of divine grace, 113 which has such lofty vapors for its rain, 114 that our sight cannot reach them,
query.result: 112 mes rag lewder an grasow dowr, 113 a wra ow gwrello moy a vaporyow ughel, 114 na’n gall an golwg ni mos dos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 questi fu tal ne la sua vita nova 116 virtüalmente, ch’ogne abito destro 117 fatto averebbe in lui mirabil prova.
query.error: **English:** 115 this man was such in his new life 116 virtually, that every right habit 117 would have made a marvelous demonstration in him.
query.result: 115 An den-ma a wra vel henna yn y vewnans nowydh, 116 yn virtuel, kepar pub kostom da 117 a wra ow gwreys prof marvilus ena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Ma tanto più maligno e più silvestro 119 si fa ’l terren col mal seme e non cólto, 120 quant’ elli ha più di buon vigor terrestro.
query.error: **English:** 118 But the land becomes all the more malignant and wild 119 with bad seed and without cultivation, 120 the more good earthly vigor it has.
query.result: 118 Mes kemmys moy an norvys a wra drok ha moy gwyls, 119 vel henna an norvys a wra ow teudhi gans had egin ha heb colji, 120 pub moy a wra ytho a nerth da yn y honan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Alcun tempo il sostenni col mio volto: 122 mostrando li occhi giovanetti a lui, 123 meco il menava in dritta parte vòlto.
query.error: **English:** 121 For some time I sustained him with my countenance: 122 showing him my youthful eyes, 123 I led him with me, turned toward the right path.
query.result: 121 Rag unn termyn y’m sostenas gans y’m golwg: 122 ow tos ow lagha yowynk dhe’n den-na, 123 gansov y’m gorra yn fordh owen ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Sì tosto come in su la soglia fui 125 di mia seconda etade e mutai vita, 126 questi si tolse a me, e diessi altrui.
query.error: **English:** 124 As soon as I was on the threshold 125 of my second age and changed my life, 126 this man took himself from me and gave himself to another.
query.result: 124 Kyns ovel a’n oen war-barth an fordh 125 a’m oyl esa yn y’m nessa nessa, ha’m chanjas y’m bewnans, 126 an den-ma a wra ow kemer y honan dhyworthov ha’n gorra dhe unn aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Quando di carne a spirto era salita, 128 e bellezza e virtù cresciuta m’era, 129 fu’ io a lui men cara e men gradita;
query.error: **English:** 127 When from flesh to spirit she had ascended, 128 and beauty and virtue had grown in me, 129 I was less dear and less pleasing to him;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 e volse i passi suoi per via non vera, 131 imagini di ben seguendo false, 132 che nulla promession rendono intera.
query.error: **English:** 130 and he turned his steps along a false path, 131 following false images of good, 132 which make no promise whole.
query.result: 130 hag ev a droes y gammow dhe fordh na wodha, 131 ow sewya imajys a dhaswel fals, 132 na wra aga promisyon gwir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Né l’impetrare ispirazion mi valse, 134 con le quali e in sogno e altrimenti 135 lo rivocai: sì poco a lui ne calse!
query.error: **English:** 133 Nor did my prayers for inspiration avail me, 134 with which, both in dreams and otherwise, 135 I called him back: so little did he care!
query.result: 133 Na'm bisysi inspirashyon vyth vala, 134 gans an re beu yn hunros ha yn fordhow, 135 y'm galwas ev: mar bel oedh ev ow kolla!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Tanto giù cadde, che tutti argomenti 137 a la salute sua eran già corti, 138 fuor che mostrarli le perdute genti.
query.error: **English:** 136 So low had he fallen that all arguments 137 for his salvation were now too short, 138 except to show him the lost people.
query.result: 136 Mar isel oedh ev kewsys, an pub argumens 137 dhe y achubans oedh byttegyns byskas, 138 mes dhe dhiskwedhes an dus a gollas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Per questo visitai l’uscio d’i morti, 140 e a colui che l’ha qua sù condotto, 141 li prieghi miei, piangendo, furon porti.
query.error: **English:** 139 For this reason I visited the gate of the dead, 140 and to the one who led him here above, 141 my prayers, weeping, were carried.
query.result: 139 Rag an ke, y'm visitas porth an merwis, 140 ha dhe'n neb a'y ledyas ama, 141 y'm pednow, ow weli, oedh porthys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Alto fato di Dio sarebbe rotto, 143 se Letè si passasse e tal vivanda 144 fosse gustata sanza alcuno scotto
query.error: **English:** 142 God's high decree would be broken, 143 if Lethe were crossed and such food 144 were tasted without any penalty
query.result: 142 Fatel uhel a Dhew a vydh torrys, 143 mar Letè a vydh passys ha kevel pareil 144 a vydh blasys heb mar skoth

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 di pentimento che lagrime spanda».
query.error: **English:** 145 of repentance that sheds tears.
query.result: 145 a dhesempis ow tyrra degerow».
